poem:
Title: Beneath the Cloak of Fear

Binders of hate, young hearts confide,
In the shadow of ignorance, humans collide.
A queer scholar, worn by hate's invading tide,
Yet, standing tall, dignity to provide.
Truth and kindness, the armory he wields,
Turning points at inflection, his spirit shields.
Assault not the minds with rigid thought,
Bend to compassion, don't be cruelly caught.
